citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 9:51am on
September 9, 2025. The inspector attempted to contact the licensee by Telephone. Failure to provide access to the
facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result
in enforcement action.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
An unannounced, routine inspection was attempted at 9:51 am on September 10, 2025. A responsible adult was not
available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process. Phone calls were not immediately answered;
however, a requested return call was received at 10:40 am. The licensee stated that he was traveling and exhibiting his
animals out of state. A written itinerary was not submitted by the licensee prior to exhibiting with overnight travel.
Itineraries are necessary to allow for the inspection of traveling exhibitors to confirm compliance with the Animal Welfare
Act, notably regarding the animal care and welfare while traveling.
The licensee must submit a written itinerary to the Deputy Administrator no fewer than two days in advance of any travel
and shall contain complete and accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at
any location other than the person’s approved site. To be corrected from this date, September 9, 2025, forward.
End Section
